column4: bonjour is the compatability program set for macintosh, the rest i'm not sure of unavailable
I'm also Yooshi,  would you happen to know much about samba/XP shares?
no i'm not familiar with samba at all, i've done a lot of file sharing with windows and some with nautilus on linux
well to do file sharing you need samba, it installs it for you so I figured you'd know
no i had no clue, it must have been installed for me or something, mine works but i didn't set up anything
I'm also trying to get it to require authencation to even see the ubuntu shares
i could try to find out but i have no idea, never did any of that
when you create a share you can make it so they have to login
it's on the second tab when making the share
really? I didn't see a 2nd tab... but I'll look
you go to the samba gui and double click the share, it's the access tab
what samba gui? guess I'll go look now
install the samba gui via add/remove and then go to it
lol oh... didn't realize samba required a gui too :P

I got the samba GUI, I had the /root shared via the folder sharing properties then when I looked at the samba gui it wasn't there, so I manually added it in which it did... but then when I looked at the folder sharing properties it is no longer shared and I can still access it without logging in even though I selected a user already
what do you use for samba GUI?
I believe there are a few of them
